intro: Anarrhinum bellidifolium var. majus, commonly known as the greater bellidifolium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue with a distinctive pubescent surface. The species is adapted to rocky and dry soils, making it a hardy plant in arid environments.
